H0.text: What 17th- and 18th-century weapon was a short flintlock gun with a large bore. Blunderbuss

H1.text: What 17th- and 18th-century weapon was a short flintlock gun with a large bore. Musket

H2.text: What 17th- and 18th-century weapon was a short flintlock gun with a large bore. Pistol

H3.text: What 17th- and 18th-century weapon was a short flintlock gun with a large bore. Donderbuss

A4.text: The blunderbuss is a 17th- to mid-19th-century firearm with a short, large caliber barrel.

A5.text: The blunderbuss used by the British Royal Mail during the period of 1788â€“1816 was a flintlock with a 36 cm (14 in) long flared brass barrel, brass trigger guard, and an iron trigger and lock.
